newsitem.title: FRANCE: Corsican separatists bomb tax office on mainland.
newsitem.headline: Corsican separatists bomb tax office on mainland.

text.p: Corsican separatists claimed responsibility on Tuesday for a bomb attack on a tax office in the southern French city of Perpignan, which badly damaged the front of the building but caused no injuries.
The Corsican National Liberation Front (FLNC) "Historical Wing" said it had carried out the bombing early on Tuesday, as well as four other recent blasts on the French Mediterranean island.
In eastern Corsica, a bomb exploded at a savings bank and police defused a second device planted by suspected separatists on the island.
No one was hurt when the bomb, linked to a gas canister, exploded outside a savings bank in Ghisonaccia, smashing windows and damaging the facade and furniture inside, para-military gendarmes said.
They said a similar device was found outside a branch of the Credit Agricole Mutuel de la Corse bank in the town. The detonator had failed to work and bomb disposal experts safely defused the device.
No one immediately claimed responsibility for either bomb.
Corsican separatists seeking greater autonomy for the Mediterranean resort island have carried their guerrilla campaign to mainland France in recent months and frequently target public buildings.
